page.title: 01GAZETTEER OF BENTHAM
page.content: High and Low Bentham are in North Yorkshire about 10 miles north east of Lancaster. To the north and east are the limestone hills of the Yorkshire Dales. To the west is the Lune Valley and on the southern edge is Burnmoor. The River Wenning is a tributary of the River Lune. The railway runs from Carnforth to Leeds. The two settlemets have a combined population of about 4000. High Bentham is the larger and possesses most of the industry. George Angus is the main employer. The factory makes fire fighting equipment. There is a good range of services, shops,garages,accountants,solicitors, auctioneers and a health centre. The local affairs are looked after by the mayor and Town Council. The villages are not particularly pretty but serve a lively active community.
